intro: Chilocarpus denudatus var. sunainaianus, commonly known as the Sunainaianus chilocarpus, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a conservation concern.
